title: First Meeting Pitch
description: How to create and customize your deck for any meeting
presenter: Christian Shockley, Steve West, Emilio Di Zazzo

articleSections.heading: Prep
articleSections.content:
Download the deck and make a copy for your prospect—do not edit the master file.
Make a copy of the deck in your Google Drive
Review the prospect's industry and use case
Consider meeting length and who's attending
Allow 30-60 minutes for customization
**Callout:** High-Level Customization? If you need custom narrative, company-specific imagery, or major modifications, give PMM at least 5 business days notice.

articleSections.heading: Navigate
articleSections.content:
Use Command+F (or Ctrl+F) to search for keywords—no need to memorize slide locations.
Search for industry keywords to find vertical kits
Search for feature names to find capability slides
Search "POV" for positioning slides

articleSections.heading: Assess AI Journey
articleSections.content:
Determine where your prospect sits in their AI adoption journey.
Traditional CX → Lead with hero-focused slides
AI-Ready → Lead with AI-forward narrative and Sidekick
Enterprise → Include architecture and security slides

articleSections.heading: Customize
articleSections.content:
Leverage available assets and tailor for your specific meeting.
Use Social Proof Library for relevant customer examples
Pull Vertical Kit slides for industry-specific imagery
Customize for meeting length (15 min vs 60 min)
Adjust for audience: 1:1 with contact vs buying committee
Remove slides that don't apply

articleSections.heading: Share Feedback
articleSections.content:
The deck is meant to be "scuffed up"—customize aggressively and share what lands.
Tag Christian, Steve, and Austin when using customized versions
Share feedback on what content resonates with prospects
Report any gaps or missing content

keyTakeaways: New: **Inside the Deck** — POV Slides (Problem & Gladly's perspective), Solution Overview (Platform capabilities & features), Additional Slides Arsenal (Deep-dive slides on specific topics), Vertical Kits (Travel, Telco, QSR, Retail & more), AI-Forward Narrative (New GTM positioning & Sidekick), Social Proof Library (Customer logos, quotes, case studies).
Updated: **First Meeting Deck Template** — The mega deck is now your one-stop, everything-included resource for any first meeting.
Updated: **Vertical Kits Expanded** — Added new industry-specific slides for telecommunications and QSR with matching product images.
Coming Soon: **AI-Forward Company Narrative** — Updated GTM positioning reflecting Gladly's transition to an AI-forward company. Expected early December.
Coming Soon: **Architecture & Model Enablement** — Everly is refining materials covering underlying model architecture and technical enablement.
actionItems: **Think of it like cleats:** Customize aggressively and share feedback on what lands. The deck improves when you report back.
**Command+F is your friend:** The deck has 150+ slides. Navigate by searching for keywords—don't try to memorize locations.
**Match the narrative to maturity:** Don't force AI-forward messaging on hero-focused prospects. Meet them where they are.
Don't edit the master file—always make a copy first.
Don't use 150 slides in one meeting—be selective based on the prospect and time available.
Don't skip the vertical kits or Social Proof Library—industry-specific content dramatically increases relevance.
Don't wait until last minute for major customizations—PMM needs 5+ days for custom narrative or imagery.

faqs.question: How do I navigate a 150+ slide deck?
faqs.answer: Use Command+F (or Ctrl+F) to search for keywords. Search for industry names, feature names, or "POV" to jump directly to relevant slides.

faqs.question: Should I use the existing or new AI narrative?
faqs.answer: The updated AI narrative is coming in early December. Until then, assess your prospect's AI maturity—traditional CX prospects respond better to hero-focused messaging, while AI-ready prospects can receive the full AI-forward narrative.

faqs.question: What if I need major customizations?
faqs.answer: For high-level customizations like custom narrative or company-specific imagery, contact PMM at least 5 business days in advance. Standard customizations (pulling slides, adding logos) can be done yourself.

faqs.question: Who owns feedback on the deck?
faqs.answer: Tag Christian Shockley (owner), Steve West, and Austin when you use customized versions. This helps track what content works and what's missing.

faqs.question: What vertical kits are available?
faqs.answer: Currently: Travel/Hospitality, Telecommunications, QSR, and Retail. Each kit includes industry-specific product images, use cases, and customer examples.

faqs.question: What about SMB/Hero-pitching?
faqs.answer: SMB team members (Christine, Karl Rehfuss) can provide feedback on modifications needed for hero-pitching scenarios.
